required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Investigational Immuno-Therapy Safety and Efficacy Study of Multiple Administration Regimens for Nivolumab Plus Ipilimumab in Subjects With Renal Cell Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II, Randomized, Study of Multiple Administration Regimens for Nivolumab Plus Ipilimumab in Subjects With Renal Cell Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate safety and efficacy of different administration regimens of nivolumab plus ipilimumab in subjects with renal cell carcinoma.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence Rate of Adverse Events (AEs) in the Broad Scope MedDRA Anaphylactic Reaction SMQ Within 2 Days After Any Dose in Combination Period.
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of randomization to end of combination period (assessed up to November 24th, 2017, approximately 9 months)
primary_outcome.description: This incidence rate is defined as the number of participants who experienced at least 1 AE in the MedDRA Anaphylactic Reaction broad scope SMQ with onset on the day of or within 2 days after any study therapy infusion during the combination period (Part 1) divided by number of treated participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence Rate of AEs in the Narrow Scope MedDRA Anaphylactic Reaction SMQ Occurring Within 2 Days After Any Dose in the Part 1 Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of randomization to end of combination period (assessed up to November 24th, 2017, approximately 9 months)
secondary_outcome.description: This incidence rate is defined similarly to the primary endpoint except that the event rate will be based on terms within the narrow scope SMQ rather than the broad scope.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence Rate of Drug Related Grade 3-5 AEs.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of randomization to end of combination period (assessed up to November 24th, 2017, approximately 9 months)
secondary_outcome.description: The drug-related Grade 3 - 5 AE rate is defined as number of participants who experienced at least 1 AE of Grade 3 or higher, judged to be related to study treatment by the investigator, with onset on or after the first dose of study treatment and within 30 days of the last dose of study treatment, divided by number of treated participants. Evaluated using Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI CTCAE) version 4.0 criteria.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence Rate of All Causality Grade 3-5 AE
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of randomization to end of combination period (assessed up to November 24th, 2017, approximately 9 months)
secondary_outcome.description: The all causality Grade 3 - 5 AE rate is defined as number of participants who experienced at least 1 AE of Grade 3 or higher with onset on or after the first dose of study treatment and within 30 days of the last dose of study treatment, divided by number of treated participants. Evaluated using the NCI CTCAE version 4.0 criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Nivolumab and Ipilimumab Geometric Mean Concentrations at End of Infusion (EOI) and Predose at Cycle 1, 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of first dose to end of combination stage approximately 9 months
secondary_outcome.description: To determine pharmacokinetics (PK) comparisons of Nivolumab and Ipilimumab administered as FRC to that of sequentially administered Nivolumab and Ipilimumab. PK will be measured using serum concentration-time data.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of first dose to end of combination stage approximately 9 months
secondary_outcome.description: The ORR is defined as the number of participants with a BOR of CR or PR divided by the number of treated participants. The BOR is defined as the best response designation, as determined by the investigator, recorded between the date of randomization and the date of objectively documented progression per RECIST 1.1 or the date of first subsequent anti-cancer therapy including radiotherapy, tumor-directed surgery, or systemic anticancer therapy, whichever occurs first. For participants without documented progression or subsequent therapy, all available response designations will contribute to the BOR assessment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of first dose to end of combination stage approximately 9 months
secondary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the time between the date of randomization and the first date of documented progression, as determined by the investigator, or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding Bristol-Myers Squibb Clinical Trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com
Inclusion Criteria:
- Advanced Renal Cell Carcinoma
- Must have full activity or, if limited, must be able to walk and carry out light activities such as light house work or office work
- Must have at least 1 lesion with measurable disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with active central nervous system metastases
- Subjects who received prior therapy with checkpoint inhibitor
- Subjects with active, known or suspected autoimmune disease
Other protocol defined inclusion/exclusion criteria could apply

facility.name: University Of Iowa Hospitals And Clinics

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Adverse Event Unrelated to Study Drug

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Incidence Rate of Adverse Events (AEs) in the Broad Scope MedDRA Anaphylactic Reaction SMQ Within 2 Days After Any Dose in Combination Period.
outcome.description: This incidence rate is defined as the number of participants who experienced at least 1 AE in the MedDRA Anaphylactic Reaction broad scope SMQ with onset on the day of or within 2 days after any study therapy infusion during the combination period (Part 1) divided by number of treated participants.
outcome.time_frame: From the time of randomization to end of combination period (assessed up to November 24th, 2017, approximately 9 months)

measure.title: Incidence Rate of Adverse Events (AEs) in the Broad Scope MedDRA Anaphylactic Reaction SMQ Within 2 Days After Any Dose in Combination Period.
measure.description: This incidence rate is defined as the number of participants who experienced at least 1 AE in the MedDRA Anaphylactic Reaction broad scope SMQ with onset on the day of or within 2 days after any study therapy infusion during the combination period (Part 1) divided by number of treated participants.

outcome.title: Incidence Rate of AEs in the Narrow Scope MedDRA Anaphylactic Reaction SMQ Occurring Within 2 Days After Any Dose in the Part 1 Period
outcome.description: This incidence rate is defined similarly to the primary endpoint except that the event rate will be based on terms within the narrow scope SMQ rather than the broad scope.
outcome.time_frame: From the time of randomization to end of combination period (assessed up to November 24th, 2017, approximately 9 months)

measure.title: Incidence Rate of AEs in the Narrow Scope MedDRA Anaphylactic Reaction SMQ Occurring Within 2 Days After Any Dose in the Part 1 Period
measure.description: This incidence rate is defined similarly to the primary endpoint except that the event rate will be based on terms within the narrow scope SMQ rather than the broad scope.

outcome.title: Incidence Rate of Drug Related Grade 3-5 AEs.
outcome.description: The drug-related Grade 3 - 5 AE rate is defined as number of participants who experienced at least 1 AE of Grade 3 or higher, judged to be related to study treatment by the investigator, with onset on or after the first dose of study treatment and within 30 days of the last dose of study treatment, divided by number of treated participants. Evaluated using Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI CTCAE) version 4.0 criteria.
outcome.time_frame: From the time of randomization to end of combination period (assessed up to November 24th, 2017, approximately 9 months)

measure.title: Incidence Rate of Drug Related Grade 3-5 AEs.
measure.description: The drug-related Grade 3 - 5 AE rate is defined as number of participants who experienced at least 1 AE of Grade 3 or higher, judged to be related to study treatment by the investigator, with onset on or after the first dose of study treatment and within 30 days of the last dose of study treatment, divided by number of treated participants. Evaluated using Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI CTCAE) version 4.0 criteria.

outcome.title: Incidence Rate of All Causality Grade 3-5 AE
outcome.description: The all causality Grade 3 - 5 AE rate is defined as number of participants who experienced at least 1 AE of Grade 3 or higher with onset on or after the first dose of study treatment and within 30 days of the last dose of study treatment, divided by number of treated participants. Evaluated using the NCI CTCAE version 4.0 criteria
outcome.time_frame: From the time of randomization to end of combination period (assessed up to November 24th, 2017, approximately 9 months)

measure.title: Incidence Rate of All Causality Grade 3-5 AE
measure.description: The all causality Grade 3 - 5 AE rate is defined as number of participants who experienced at least 1 AE of Grade 3 or higher with onset on or after the first dose of study treatment and within 30 days of the last dose of study treatment, divided by number of treated participants. Evaluated using the NCI CTCAE version 4.0 criteria

outcome.title: Nivolumab and Ipilimumab Geometric Mean Concentrations at End of Infusion (EOI) and Predose at Cycle 1, 2 and 4
outcome.description: To determine pharmacokinetics (PK) comparisons of Nivolumab and Ipilimumab administered as FRC to that of sequentially administered Nivolumab and Ipilimumab. PK will be measured using serum concentration-time data.
outcome.time_frame: From the date of first dose to end of combination stage approximately 9 months

outcome.title: Objective Response Rate (ORR)
outcome.description: The ORR is defined as the number of participants with a BOR of CR or PR divided by the number of treated participants. The BOR is defined as the best response designation, as determined by the investigator, recorded between the date of randomization and the date of objectively documented progression per RECIST 1.1 or the date of first subsequent anti-cancer therapy including radiotherapy, tumor-directed surgery, or systemic anticancer therapy, whichever occurs first. For participants without documented progression or subsequent therapy, all available response designations will contribute to the BOR assessment
outcome.time_frame: From the date of first dose to end of combination stage approximately 9 months

outcome.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: PFS is defined as the time between the date of randomization and the first date of documented progression, as determined by the investigator, or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first
outcome.time_frame: From the date of first dose to end of combination stage approximately 9 months

reported_events.time_frame: From the date of first dose to end of combination stage (assessed up to November 27th, 2017, approximately 9 months)

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period 60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Nivolumab plus Ipilimumab in Subjects with Renal Cell Carcinoma
